Name: Standing Statue of Sed-Hotep
Description: The statue represents Sed-Hotep standing with his left leg forward. He wears a wig painted black that reaches his shoulders. He holds a roll in each hand, and is wearing a kilt. There is a dagger under his belt. His name is inscribed on the base of the statue.The statue was discovered in fragments in the debris of the northern chamber of his mastaba, or tomb, at Giza necropolis during excavations by a team from Cairo University
